comment.body:
Niestety nie potrafię odtworzyć tego problemu.
<details><summary>Obrazek</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/6caaa321-f29e-4d70-919a-70b0c8205400)

</details>

Z tego co widzę, na drugim zrzucie ekranu AdGuard jest wyłączony i nadal pojawia się komunikat o blokadzie reklam.
Może problem powoduje jakieś inne rozszerzenie, jeśli się nie mylę, to program Kaspersky Internet Security ma funkcję blokowania reklam/banerów i to może ona powoduje problem.
Ewentualnie może być to spowodowane opcją filtrowania DNS (chociaż u mnie to nie powoduje problemu), ale warto sprawdzić, czy po wyłączeniu tej opcji ten komunikat nadal się pojawia.

Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Sorry. Missed the first message.

I've tried each of the three sets of rules requested by adding the rule, clearing the cache in Safari and then refreshing the page. None of the three sets changed the behaviour. 

As a sanity check I then paused AdGuard for Safari and repeated the test process. At which point the page started working properly again. 

This is on Version 1.11.13 (build 297, CT 2.0.39), with the rules updated at 28 July 2023, 09:24

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/157484#issue-1822983234 - It might be related to this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2372
When the browser starts with opened website, the extension may be initialised too late and some ads may not be blocked.

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/157484#issuecomment-1652752912 - Unfortunately, ads in YouTube app cannot be blocked - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/4827
